oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Robust passification using norm bounded uncertainty models
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: MANJAREKAR, NS
BANAVAR, RN
KELKAR, AG
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: systems
passivity
robust passification
coprime factor uncertainty
norm bounded uncertainty
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Passivity based controllers are known to provide robust stability for inherently passive dynamic systems. Recently, with the development of "passification" techniques, these controllers are also shown to be effective in robust stabilization of non-passive systems. However, the robustness of stability in this case depends on the robustness of passification. The frequency domain sufficient conditions also exist in the literature for checking robustness of passification. This paper presents new conditions for robust passification using different norm-bounded uncertainty models. In particular, the coprime factor uncertainty models are considered and corresponding robust passification conditions are presented.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: CCA 2003: PROCEEDINGS OF 2003 IEEE CONFERENCE ON CONTROL APPLICATIONS, VOLS 1 AND 2,1327-1332
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: IEEE Conference on Control Applications,ISTANBUL, TURKEY,JUN 23-25, 2003
